content: I made PR #13963 about a week ago. It's a pretty big one, but also a pretty important one that's blocking pretty much all of my other work on games. As of now, it's only gotten a few disparate comments. If anyone could take a closer look, it would be much appreciated <3
Could you update the title and PR description text to reflect our previous discussion?
How so? By calling it a "mislabeled" definition instead of an "incorrect" one?
My suggestion is "bad notation", but mislabelled would be fine too.
I've updated the title and description. Is it any better?
Once again, this PR does too much. How come fuzzy be defined in a PR that aims at fixing <?
There's a lot of discussion to be had on whether we want fuzzy, and whether we should call lf gf in some lemma statements.
Can you split out a PR which just replaces the notation and renames the lemmas?
@Yaël Dillies, actually, I think this is okay as is, and is pretty close to minimal already. The point is that ⧏ is the old <. Very little is being added about fuzzy itself here.

Okay, I guess it would be slightly more minimal if this PR avoided introducing fuzzy. I wouldn't object to merging on this basis, however. Unless there's something problematic about the tiny introduction of fuzzy, I don't think being-completely-minimal is an essential criterion for PRs. :-)
